result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Griffis
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:11 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Khang B Le in court.  Vu Nguyen appeared as interpreter.  File not called on the record.  Defendant states he has not yet spoken to the Public Defenders Office.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court takes recess at 9:13 am so the defendant may apply at the Public Defenders Office by telephone.  Court re-addresses matter at 9:38 am.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court sets status of counsel date in three weeks.  Vietnamese Interpreter needed for next date.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:47 AM Defendant Khang B Le in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Long Nguyen (from SWITS) appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and reading of complaint done in Vietnamese on the record.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
VIETNAMESE INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
